title: Jehovah Raphi-The Lord that Heals
description: The names of God are actually parts of his divine nature, revealed to his children in their times of crisis. When Israel came to the Wilderness of Shur 3 days after crossing the Red Sea, they were thirsty, having used up their water, and immediately began to complain. God supplied the water, but Moses named the place "Marah" meaning bitterness. There are those of God's people who have been hurt and have the root of bitterness in them and God wants to lovingly deal with and remove it lest they be defiled by it. The Lord who heals can mend your broken heart. Part 2 of 8

title: Jehovah Rohi - The Lord is My Shepherd
Jehovah Shammah - The Lord is There
description: Ezekiel sees a vision of the glory of the Lord reluctantly departing from his idolatrous people and is grieved. Where the presence of the Lord is, there is a melting. It is dangerous to go to a church where the minister spends more time pursuing worldly methods, rather than spending time with God.

title: Jehovah Tsidkenu - The Lord Our Righteousness
Jehovah-Nissi
description: When Amalek fought Israel, God promised to have war with the generations of Amalek forever. This represented the forces of the devil against the purposes of God. The devil doesn't want you to enter into the rest of God. When you listen to the lies of the enemy and let him cause your faith to waver, you will remain in the wilderness, just as Israel did.
